page.title: 05Local History - Life Style
page.content:
Bilbrough then and now 1939-45.
Mrs.Davies aged 67 was born in the village and has spent her life here. She lived at the Old Manor House with her mother,Mrs.Jackson.This lady assisted by her family had a milk round.She had her own cows and milk was delivered by pony and trap.She took milk to Askham Richard and Colton too.Now there are 2 milkmen delivering by milk floats.Mrs.Davies remembers the army huts near the village hall. These were used for agricultural workers,although they had been intended to house refugees.Where the huts stood,there is now a pleasant bungalow.The village hall was used for first aid classes,lectures, and the Womens Institute.The W.I.has now disbanded.
